titleStmt.title: The reasons & narrative of proceedings betwixt the two Houses which were delivered by the House of Commons to the Lords at the conference touching the tryal of the Lords in the Tower on Monday the 26th of May 1679.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

notesStmt.note: Regarding the Earl of Danby's pardon and the trial of the five Lords: Earl of Powis, Viscount Stafford, Lord Petre, Lord Arundel of Wardour, and Lord Bellasis.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.

In this printing, the headline contains 23 ornaments, crowned emblems of England, France, Scotland, Wales and Ireland; line 4 of text ends 'appre-'; first line of text on p. 3 begins "wards to the Tryal"; last line on p. 4 reads "demanded Judgment ... in the Tower."
